info.title: ODIN
info.description: ODIN is a decentralized system designed to build a data oracle network (DON) based on an open protocol for interaction between participants and a sustainable economy. In addition to organizing the data oracle network, ODIN involves building a decentralized peer-to-peer data sharing and trading ecosystem. The use cases of ODIN are mainly focused on user generated data apps, Non-fungible tokens, Decentralized Finance applications and others.

get.summary: Counts queries the number of data sources, oracle scripts, and requests.

default.description: A bad request error response. To solve the error, check that the denoms are entered correctly. They must be two versions (little and large) of the same coin. For example, loki and odin.

get.summary: Inflation returns current annual provisions.
CurrentMintVolume returns current minted coins volume.
Inflation returns integration address.
Inflation returns current inflation.
Params returns the total set of minting parameters.
Inflation returns current treasury pool.
ActiveValidators queries all active oracle validators.
Counts queries the number of data sources, oracle scripts, and requests.
Data queries the data source or oracle script script for given file hash.
DataProviderAccumulatedReward queries oracle info of reporter rewards for given reporter address.

default.description: A bad request response. To solve the error, check that the address is entered correctly. The address must follow the bech32 format and have the odin prefix.

get.summary: DataSources queries data sources info.

parameters.name: pagination.key
parameters.description:
key is a value returned in PageResponse.next_key to begin
querying the next page most efficiently. Only one of offset or key
should be set.

parameters.name: pagination.offset
parameters.description:
offset is a numeric offset that can be used when key is unavailable.
It is less efficient than using key. Only one of offset or key should
be set.

parameters.name: pagination.limit
parameters.description:
limit is the total number of results to be returned in the result page.
If left empty it will default to a value to be set by each app.

parameters.name: pagination.count_total
parameters.description:
count_total is set to true  to indicate that the result set should include
a count of the total number of items available for pagination in UIs.
count_total is only respected when offset is used. It is ignored when key
is set.

parameters.name: pagination.reverse
parameters.description:
reverse is set to true if results are to be returned in the descending order.

Since: cosmos-sdk 0.43

parameters.name: validator_address

get.summary: IsReporter queries grant of account on this validator.

parameters.description: ValidatorAddress is a validator address

parameters.name: reporter_address
parameters.description: ReporterAddress is a candidate account

get.summary: RequestVerification verifies a request to make sure that all information that will be used to report the data is valid

default.description: A bad request response.  To solve the error, check that the chain ID is entered correctly. Chain ID is available upon request https://node.odin-freya-website.odinprotocol.io/a/status?. Also check that the validator and reporter addresses are entered correctly. The addresses must follow the bech32 format and have the odinvaloper prefix for validator and odin prefix for reporter.

parameters.name: chain_id
parameters.description:
ChainID is the chain ID to identify which chain ID is used for the
verification.

parameters.name: validator
parameters.description: Validator is a validator address.

parameters.name: request_id
parameters.description: RequestID is oracle request ID.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: ExternalID is an oracle's external ID.

parameters.name: reporter
parameters.description:
Reporter is an bech32-encoded public key of the reporter authorized by the
validator.

parameters.name: signature
parameters.description:
Signature is a signature signed by the reporter using reporter's private
key.

get.summary: Validator queries oracle info of validator for given validator address.

default.description: A bad request error response. To solve the error, check that the address is entered correctly. The address must follow the bech32 format and have the odinvaloper prefix.

pending.title: Pending is the status of the auction (active or not)

auction_start_threshold.title: AuctionStartThreshold is the threshold at which the auction starts

exchange_rates.title: ExchangeRate is a rate for buying coins throw the auction

auction.Params.description: Params is the data structure that keeps the parameters of the auction module.

auction.QueryAuctionStatusResponse.description: QueryAuctionStatusResponse is response type for the Query/Status RPC method.

auction.QueryParamsResponse.description: QueryCountsResponse is response type for the Query/Params RPC method.

cosmos.base.v1beta1.Coin.description:
Coin defines a token with a denomination and an amount.

NOTE: The amount field is an Int which implements the custom method
signatures required by gogoproto.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

key.description:
key is a value returned in PageResponse.next_key to begin
querying the next page most efficiently. Only one of offset or key
should be set.

offset.description:
offset is a numeric offset that can be used when key is unavailable.
It is less efficient than using key. Only one of offset or key should
be set.

limit.description:
limit is the total number of results to be returned in the result page.
If left empty it will default to a value to be set by each app.

count_total.description:
count_total is set to true  to indicate that the result set should include
a count of the total number of items available for pagination in UIs.
count_total is only respected when offset is used. It is ignored when key
is set.

reverse.description:
reverse is set to true if results are to be returned in the descending order.

Since: cosmos-sdk 0.43

cosmos.base.query.v1beta1.PageRequest.title:
PageRequest is to be embedded in gRPC request messages for efficient
pagination. Ex:

next_key.description:
next_key is the key to be passed to PageRequest.key to
query the next page most efficiently. It will be empty if
there are no more results.

total.title:
total is total number of results available if PageRequest.count_total
was set, its value is undefined otherwise

address.description: address is the address of the balance holder.

coins.description: coins defines the different coins this balance holds.

cosmos.base.v1beta1.BondStatus.description:
BondStatus is the status of a validator.

 - BOND_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: UNSPECIFIED defines an invalid validator status.
 - BOND_STATUS_UNBONDED: UNBONDED defines a validator that is not bonded.
 - BOND_STATUS_UNBONDING: UNBONDING defines a validator that is unbonding.
 - BOND_STATUS_BONDED: BONDED defines a validator that is bonded.

update_time.description: update_time is the last time the commission rate was changed.

cosmos.base.v1beta1.Commission.description: Commission defines commission parameters for a given validator.

rate.description: rate is the commission rate charged to delegators, as a fraction.

max_rate.description: max_rate defines the maximum commission rate which validator can ever charge, as a fraction.

max_change_rate.description: max_change_rate defines the maximum daily increase of the validator commission, as a fraction.

cosmos.base.v1beta1.CommissionRates.description:
CommissionRates defines the initial commission rates to be used for creating
a validator.

moniker.description: moniker defines a human-readable name for the validator.

identity.description: identity defines an optional identity signature (ex. UPort or Keybase).

website.description: website defines an optional website link.

security_contact.description: security_contact defines an optional email for security contact.

operator_address.description: operator_address defines the address of the validator's operator; bech encoded in JSON.

jailed.description: jailed defined whether the validator has been jailed from bonded status or not.

tokens.description: tokens define the delegated tokens (incl. self-delegation).

delegator_shares.description: delegator_shares defines total shares issued to a validator's delegators.

unbonding_height.description: unbonding_height defines, if unbonding, the height at which this validator has begun unbonding.

unbonding_time.description: unbonding_time defines, if unbonding, the min time for the validator to complete unbonding.

min_self_delegation.description: min_self_delegation is the validator's self declared minimum self delegation.

cosmos.base.v1beta1.Validator.description:
Validator defines a validator, together with the total amount of the
Validator's bond shares and their exchange rate to coins. Slashing results in
a decrease in the exchange rate, allowing correct calculation of future
undelegations without iterating over delegators. When coins are delegated to
this validator, the validator is credited with a delegation whose number of
bond shares is based on the amount of coins delegated divided by the current
exchange rate. Voting power can be calculated as total bonded shares
multiplied by exchange rate.

oracle.v1.DataSource.description: DataSource is the data structure for storing data sources in the storage.

oracle.v1.OracleScript.description: OracleScript is the data structure for storing oracle scripts in the storage.

max_raw_request_count.description:
MaxRawRequestCount is the maximum number of data source raw requests a
request can make.

max_ask_count.description: MaxAskCount is the maximum number of validators a request can target.

expiration_block_count.description:
ExpirationBlockCount is the number of blocks a request stays valid before
it gets expired due to insufficient reports.

base_owasm_gas.description:
BaseOwasmGas is the base amount of Cosmos-SDK gas charged for owasm
execution.

per_validator_request_gas.description:
PerValidatorRequestGas is the amount of Cosmos-SDK gas charged per
requested validator.

sampling_try_count.description:
SamplingTryCount the number of validator sampling tries to pick the highest
voting power subset of validators to perform an oracle task.

oracle_reward_percentage.description:
OracleRewardPercentage is the percentage of block rewards allocated to
active oracle validators.

inactive_penalty_duration.description:
InactivePenaltyDuration is the duration period where a validator cannot
activate back after missing an oracle report.

max_data_size.title:
MaxDataSize is the maximum number of bytes that can be present in the
report as the result

max_calldata_size.title:
MaxCalldataSize is the maximum number of bytes that can be present in the
calldata

data_provider_reward_per_byte.title: DataProviderRewardPerByte is the amount of tokens, user gets for the byte of data provided

reward_decreasing_fraction.title: RewardDecreasingFraction is the percentage by which the cost of data per byte is reduced when the limit is reached

data_requester_fee_denoms.title: Denominations that can be used for withdrawing fee from data requesters

oracle.v1.Params.description: Params is the data structure that keeps the parameters of the oracle module.

Reports is list of result data as raw reports that are fulfilled by
assigned validators

oracle.v1.QueryRequestResponse.description: QueryRequestResponse is response type for the Query/Request RPC method.

oracle.v1.QueryRequestResponse.BadReques.description: QueryRequestResponse is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, try to input different (lesser) number.

result.example: decoding bech32 failed: invalid checksum (expected 3xsq2g got wvumwr)

oracle.v1.QueryReportersResponse.BadRequ.description: QueryReportersResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, check that the address is entered correctly. The address must follow the bech32 format and have the odinvaloper prefix.

oracle.v1.QueryDataSourceResponse.BadReq.description: QueryDataSourceResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, try to input different (lesser) number.

oracle.v1.QueryOracleScriptResponse.BadR.description: QueryOracleScriptResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, try to input different (lesser) number.

message.example: decoding bech32 failed: invalid checksum (expected c9sd90 got gs39am): invalid request

oracle.v1.QueryDataProviderAccumulatedRe.description: QueryDataProviderAccumulatedRewardResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, check that the address is entered correctly. The address must follow the bech32 format and have the odin prefix.

message.example: rpc error: code = InvalidArgument desc = unable to parse given validator address: decoding bech32 failed: invalid checksum (expected yvjhfz got gav3rj): invalid request

oracle.v1.QueryPendingRequestsResponse.B.description: QueryPendingRequestsResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, check that the address is entered correctly. The address must follow the bech32 format and have the odinvaloper prefix.

message.example: decoding bech32 failed: invalid checksum (expected c9sd90 got gs39am): invalid request

oracle.v1.QueryIsReporterResponse.BadReq.description: QueryRequestResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, check that the validator and reporter addresses are entered correctly. The addresses must follow the bech32 format and have the odinvaloper prefix for validator and odin prefix for reporter.

message.example: rpc error: code = FailedPrecondition desc = provided chain ID does not match the validator's chain ID; expected odin-testnet-havi-1, got : invalid request

oracle.v1.QueryRequestVerificationRespon.description: QueryRequestVerificationResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, check that the chain ID is entered correctly. Chain ID is available upon request :26657/status?.

message.example: decoding bech32 failed: invalid checksum (expected yvjhfz got gav3rj): invalid request

oracle.v1.QueryValidatorResponse.BadRequ.description: QueryValidatorResponse.BadRequest is response type for the Query/Request RPC method. To solve the error, check that the address is entered correctly. The address must follow the bech32 format and have the odinvaloper prefix.

oracle.v1.QueryRequestSearchResponse.description: QueryRequestSearchResponse is response type for the Query/RequestSearch RPC method.

chain_id.title: ChainID is the targeted chain ID

validator.title: Validator is the targeted validator address

request_id.title: RequestID is the ID of targeted request

external_id.title: ExternalID is the ID of targeted oracle's external data source

data_source_id.title:
DataSourceID is the ID of a data source that relates to the targeted
external ID

oracle.v1.QueryRequestVerificationRespon.title:
QueryRequestVerificationResponse is response type for the
Query/RequestVerification RPC

oracle.v1.QueryRequestsResponse.description: QueryRequestsResponse is response type for the Query/Requests RPC method.

oracle.v1.QueryValidatorResponse.description: QueryValidatorResponse is response type for the Query/Validator RPC method.

oracle.v1.RawReport.description: RawRequest is the data structure for storing raw reporter in the storage.

oracle.v1.RawRequest.description: RawRequest is the data structure for storing raw requests in the storage.

oracle.v1.Report.description: Report is the data structure for storing reports in the storage.

oracle.v1.Request.description: Request is the data structure for storing requests in the storage.

oracle.v1.ResolveStatus.description:
ResolveStatus encodes the status of an oracle request.

 - RESOLVE_STATUS_OPEN_UNSPECIFIED: Open - the request is not yet resolved.
 - RESOLVE_STATUS_SUCCESS: Success - the request has been resolved successfully with no errors.
 - RESOLVE_STATUS_FAILURE: Failure - an error occured during the request's resolve call.
 - RESOLVE_STATUS_EXPIRED: Expired - the request does not get enough reports from validator within the
timeframe.

client_id.description:
ClientID is the unique identifier of this oracle request, as specified by
the client. This same unique ID will be sent back to the requester with the
oracle response.

oracle_script_id.description:
OracleScriptID is the unique identifier of the oracle script to be
executed.

calldata.description: Calldata is the calldata bytes available for oracle executor to read.

ask_count.description:
AskCount is the number of validators that are requested to respond to this
oracle request. Higher value means more security, at a higher gas cost.

min_count.description:
MinCount is the minimum number of validators necessary for the request to
proceed to the execution phase. Higher value means more security, at the
cost of liveness.

request_id.description: RequestID is BandChain's unique identifier for this oracle request.

ans_count.description:
AnsCount is the number of validators among to the asked validators that
actually responded to this oracle request prior to this oracle request
being resolved.

request_time.description:
RequestTime is the UNIX epoch time at which the request was sent to
BandChain.

resolve_time.description:
ResolveTime is the UNIX epoch time at which the request was resolved to the
final result.

result.description: Result is the final aggregated value only available if status if OK.

oracle.v1.Result.title: Result encodes a result of request and store in chain

amount.title: Amount is the maximum amount of tokens that can be paid for data

blocks.title: Blocks is the number of blocks during which the sum of the reward should not exceed total_reward_amount

oracle.v1.ValidatorStatus.description: ValidatorStatus maintains whether a validator is an active oracle provider.

telemetry.QueryTopBalancesResponse.description: QueryTopBalancesResponse is response type for the Query/TopBalances RPC method.

telemetry.QueryTopValidatorsResponse.description: QueryTopValidatorsResponse is response type for the Query/TopValidators RPC method.

telemetry.QueryValidatorBlocksResponse.description: QueryValidatorBlocksResponse is response type for the Query/ValidatorBlocks RPC method.

telemetry.ValidatorBlock.description: ValidatorBlock represents block approved by validator.

telemetry.ValidatorBlockStats.description: ValidatorBlockStats represents validators blocks and stake percentage.
